intro: Boechera pulchra var. duchesnensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine regions. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
